controller

Class VerifyUserWindowController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.VerifyUserWindowController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class VerifyUserWindowController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Controller class for the User Verification Window interface. This class handles the initial password verification step for sensitive operations, particularly user account deletion. It serves as the first security layer by requiring the user to confirm their identity with their password before proceeding to additional verification steps. The controller implements JavaFX Initializable interface to properly initialize the UI components and manage the user verification workflow.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VerifyUserWindowController

        public VerifyUserWindowController()

    • Method Detail

      • setController

        public void setController(Controller controller,
                          int userDelete)
        Initializes the controller with necessary dependencies and user data. This method sets up the main controller reference, identifies the user to be deleted, and displays the current user's username in the interface. It functions similarly to a constructor for the controller setup.
        Parameters:
        controller - the main application controller that manages business logic and data operations
        userDelete - the unique identifier of the user to be deleted, or -1 if deleting the currently logged-in user

      • setOnUserDeletedCallback

        public void setOnUserDeletedCallback(java.lang.Runnable callback)
        Sets the callback function to be executed after successful user deletion. This method allows the parent controller to specify actions that should be performed once the user deletion process is completed successfully, such as navigation, UI updates, or cleanup operations.
        Parameters:
        callback - the runnable function to execute after user deletion

      • confirmButton

        public void confirmButton()
        Handles the confirmation action when the confirm button is clicked. This method validates the user's password against the stored profile password, and if successful, navigates to the next verification step (action confirmation window). It transfers the callback function to the next verification step and displays appropriate error messages for invalid or missing passwords.

      • cancelButton

        public void cancelButton()
        Handles the cancellation action when the cancel button is clicked. This method closes the user verification window without performing any further actions, effectively aborting the verification process.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle rb)
        Initializes the controller class after the FXML file has been loaded. This method is automatically called by JavaFX after the FXML document has been processed and can be used to set up additional UI components or event handlers that are not defined in the FXML file.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url - the location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known
        rb - the resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized
